old:
声がでかくてうるさかったり、反対に、小さくて
聞こえない時はそう言っておくれ
column2: When my voice is loud and annoying, or on the contrary, when it's so quiet that you can't hear, let me know.
speaker: Bertha

old:
こればっかりは習い性でね
盗賊は、ほら、いろんな状況で仕事をするからさ
column2:
It's all a habit.
Thieves, you see, work in all kinds of situations.
speaker: Bertha

old:
あたしの名前は誰でも知ってるけど、顔を知っている
人間はそういないよ
column2: Everyone knows my name, but not everyone knows my face.
speaker: Bertha

old:
できればずっとそのままが良かったけど
まあ、そうも言ってられないね
column2: If possible, I would have preferred to stay as it was, but well, I can't just keep saying that.
speaker: Bertha

old:
あたしが投獄されたのは息子の意見を
無視したからなんだ
牢屋の中で、ずいぶん反省したよ
column2:
I was imprisoned because I ignored my son's opinion.
I felt so much remorse while I was in jail.
speaker: Bertha

old: それで今の、聞き分けのいいあたしがいるのさ
column2: That's why I'm such a good listener now.
speaker: Bertha

old: 婆さんだと思ってなめるんじゃないよ？
column2: Don't think I'm just an old lady.
speaker: Bertha

old:
そのへんの爺さんなら５人でかかってきても
目じゃないさ
column2: Any old man out there, five of them could come at you and you wouldn't bat an eye.
speaker: Bertha

old: あたしは権威ってのが大キライでね
column2: I hate authority
speaker: Bertha

old:
でも、気づいたら
あたしが盗賊界の権威みたいなものさ
ああ、たまらないよ
column2:
But then I realized, I'm like the authority in the bandit world.
Oh, I can't wait!
speaker: Bertha

old:
だから、竜と王族には強くあってもらわないと
困るんだ
column2: So, we need the dragons and royalty to stay strong.
speaker: Bertha

old:
これを聞いたからってどうするわけでもないけど
レスタニアにもお宝はあるんだろう？
column2: Not that I'm going to do anything about this, but you do have treasures in Lestania, don't you?
speaker: Bertha

old:
大方、ゴブリンあたりが
ため込んでいるんじゃないかい？
column2: Most likely, the goblins are hoarding them.
speaker: Bertha

old: 長く生きると、想像もしなかったことが起こるよ
column2: If you live long enough, unexpected things happen.
speaker: Bertha

old:
悪しき竜のことはそりゃあ一大事だけど
あたしがメイロワと手を組むなんてねえ
column2: The whole Evil Dragon thing is a big deal, but I can't believe I'm working with Meirova.
speaker: Bertha

old:
あんたたちの装備には見たことのない材料が
使われているね――
落ち着いたら、ぜひ、レスタニアへ行ってみたいね
column2:
I've never seen these materials used in your equipment--
I'd love to visit Lestania when you get settled!
speaker: Bertha

old:
言っておくけどね
あたしが盗むのは王家のお宝だけさ
column2:
Just so you know
I only steal royal treasures.
speaker: Bertha

old:
でも義賊というわけじゃない
施しは好きじゃないからね
column2:
But that doesn't mean I'm a righteous bandit.
I don't like charity.
speaker: Bertha

old: あたしの息子たちもどこかで戦っているんだろうね
column2: I'm sure my sons are fighting somewhere too.
speaker: Bertha

old:
まあ、無事でいてくれればそれでいいんだ
生きていれば、また盗賊稼業を楽しめるさ
column2:
Well, just stay safe and that's all that matters.
As long as you're alive, you can enjoy being a bandit again.
speaker: Bertha

old: うん、あたしかい？
column2: Yeah, what about me?
speaker: Bertha

old:
別にあたしを助けに来たわけじゃ
ないだろう？
column2: You didn't come here to help me, did you?
speaker: Bertha

old:
ああ、構いやしないよ
で、メイロワ将軍はなんだって？
column2: Ah, I don't mind. So, what about General Meirova?
speaker: Bertha

old:
あの爺さんが頭を下げれば
解放軍に協力しないことはない
伝えといてくれ
column2:
If that old man bows his head, there's nothing he won't do to help the Liberation Army.
Please relay this.
speaker: Bertha

old:
ネド王子、気張りすぎじゃないのかい？
ありゃ、大丈夫かね
column2: Prince Nedo, aren't you trying too hard? Oh dear, are you okay?
speaker: Bertha

old:
とにかくね、敵にここまで来られたら
どうしようもないよ
column2: Anyway, if the enemy manages to come this far, there's nothing we can do.
speaker: Bertha

old: それを忘れずに戦っておくれ
column2: Remember that and keep fighting.
speaker: Bertha

old:
“悪しき竜”と対峙したことで王子はどうやら
気持ちが大きくなっているようだ
column2: It seems that the prince is feeling better after confronting the "evil dragon."
speaker: Bertha

old: これは危険な兆候だよ
column2: This is a dangerous sign.
speaker: Bertha

column2: Entrances, corridors, the royal family has a lot to hide.
speaker: Bertha

old:
それを暴くのがわたしたちの
楽しみなんだけどさ
column2: That's what we're looking forward to uncovering.
speaker: Bertha

それを暴くのがわたしたちの
楽しみなんだけどさ
column2: That's what we're looking forward to uncovering.
speaker: Bertha

old:
城に忍び込むなんてのは何度もしたけど
斬り込んで行くなんて初めてだ
column2: I've snuck into the castle many times before, but this is my first time sneaking in and attacking.
speaker: Bertha

old: 正直に言って――胸がおどるよ
column2: To be honest... my heart is pounding.
speaker: Bertha

old:
奪われたものは、ひとつひとつ
取り戻せばいいのさ
column2: What was taken from us, one by one, we'll get back.
speaker: Bertha

old: 盗賊のあたしが言うことじゃないがね
column2: As a bandit, it's not my place to say, but you know.
speaker: Bertha

old:
メガドは王都だからね
それはそれは豊かな町だったよ
盗賊の修行の場さ
column2: Because Megado is the Royal Capital, it was a very prosperous city. This is the training ground for thieves.
speaker: Bertha

old: 厄介なことになりそうだねえ
column2: Sounds like it's going to be tricky.
speaker: Bertha

old: 北の盗賊たちと一緒にあたしも行くよ
column2: I'll go with the thieves from the north.
speaker: Bertha

old:
どうしたんだい
顔色が冴えないね
column2: What's wrong? You look pale
speaker: Bertha

old:
ああ戻ったんだね
やっぱりあんたたちがいてくれないと
背中が不安だよ
column2: Oh you're back. I still need you guys. I'm worried about my back.
speaker: Bertha

old:
解放軍は再編成中さ
でもね、どんなに頑張ったって
あんたたちのいない穴は埋まらない
column2: The Liberation Army is regrouping but you know, no matter how hard we try we can't fill the hole without you guys.
speaker: Bertha

old:
そっちにも事情はあるだろうけど
最後まで付き合ってもらうよ
column2: You may have your own circumstances, but please stay with me until the end.
speaker: Bertha

old:
あとは“悪しき竜”だね
ちょっと遠回りしちまったけど
一歩一歩、追い詰めているはずだよ
column2: The Evil Dragon is the only thing remaining. Although we took a little detour; Step by step, we should be cornering it.
speaker: Bertha

old:
初めて会った頃に比べたら王子は
成長した――そう思った矢先のこれだよ
column2: Compared to when we first met, the prince has grown— that's what I thought, and just as I did, this happened.
speaker: Bertha

old:
こんな行動をするなんて
まだまだ子供だってことなんだろうね
column2: Don't act like this. It shows that you're still a child.
speaker: Bertha

old:
初めて会った頃に比べたら王子は
成長した――そう思った矢先のこれだよ

speaker: Bertha

こんな行動をするなんて
まだまだ子供だってことなんだろうね
column2: Don't act like this. It shows that you're still a child.
speaker: Bertha

old: 孫たちが世話になったね
column2: Thanks for taking care of the grandchildren.
speaker: Bertha

old:
おっと――
こんな月並みな礼をしちまうとは
あたしも歳を取ったねえ
column2: Oops-- I can't believe I'm resorting to such a clichéd gesture. I guess I'm getting old.
speaker: Bertha

old:
王子の不在が噂になり始めたよ
あんたらの耳にも入ると思うけど
放っておきな
column2: The absence of the prince has started to become a rumor, you know. But just leave it alone.
speaker: Bertha

old: あたしがなんとかするからさ
column2: I'll take care of it.
speaker: Bertha

old:
人生ってのはほんと気紛れだね
何が起こるかわからない
column2:
Life is really unpredictable.
You never know what will happen.
speaker: Bertha

old:
ああ、この歳になっても
驚くようなことはまだまだいっぱい起こるよ
column2: Oh, even at this age, there are still many surprising things happening.
speaker: Bertha

old:
城内は静かなものさ
みんな自分を見つめ直しているんだろうね
column2:
The inside of the castle is quiet.
Everyone is reflecting on themselves.
speaker: Bertha

old:
王子は重要人物には違いないけど
主人公は解放軍のひとりひとりだ
王子のことばかり思っちゃいられないさ
column2:
The prince must be an important person, but the hero is one of the liberation army too.
You can't think only about the prince.
speaker: Bertha

old:
フィンダムの竜に起こったことを
小耳に挟んだよ
column2: I heard a rumor about what happened to Phindym's dragon.
speaker: Bertha

old:
フィンダムへ行って、話を聞いた方が
良さそうだね
column2: Sounds like it would be better to go to Phindym and talk to them.
speaker: Bertha
